lines.text: [Mike's best friend, Tim Rourke, has been shot]
The police are handling this case and we haven't asked for any outside help.
I don't feel like fighting with you, Rafferty. All I want is the person responsible for *that*.
So does everyone. What do you supposed a detective bureau is for?
I've often wondered.
[Phyllis finds Mike sitting on the floor of Tim's apartment rubbing his chin]
Oh, now you look natural. Mike Shayne, can't I leave you for an hour without you getting beaten up?
Seems like old times. I guess I was getting soft.
Are you hurt?
No. No, just my vanity.
[addressing Brenner when his two henchmen enter his office]
Ah, the affidavit collectors. Of course, they're not working for you - or will you fool me and tell me the truth?
How come Bugeye let him in?
Bugeye is now Shuteye. He's a sucker for a left.
[to Mike after he confronts Brenner and his thugs]
What, no black eye?
It's the day off for the strong-arm boys. They only work five days a week now, you know - union regulations.
Is Mrs. Smith a brunette?
No sir! You never seen a blonde like that lady. Why, she'd shine in the dark!
There's too many blondes in this case. I'm having blonde nightmares. I hope I never see another blonde as long as I live.
May I have that in writing?
...With options.
[last lines]
Tim, notice anything strange about Mike?
No. What?
This is the first time he ever got through a case without being laid out like a rug.
Let me tell you one thing - nobody ever lays Mike Shayne out like a rug!
[a nurse entering Tim's room slams the door into Mike's head, knocking him out]

[talking on the telephone]
Give me the Admission desk... Send another bed up to Room 216.
[interviewing an African-American doorman]
I'm in the market for some information.
You've come to the right market, suh... the black market. Sellin' information is what I is most fond of.
